segment.source: App-V 4.6 SP3 Release Notes

segment.source: To search these Release Notes, press CTRL+F.
segment.target: To search these Release Notes, press CTRL+F.

segment.source: Read these Release Notes thoroughly before you install the Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) Management System.
segment.target: Read these Release Notes thoroughly before you install the Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) Management System.

segment.source: These Release Notes contain information that helps you successfully install Application Virtualization (App-V) 4.6 SP3.
segment.target: These Release Notes contain information that helps you successfully install Application Virtualization (App-V) 4.6 SP3.

segment.source: This document contains information that is not available in the product documentation.
segment.target: This document contains information that is not available in the product documentation.

segment.source: If there is a difference between these Release Notes and other App-V documentation, the latest change should be considered authoritative.
segment.target: If there is a difference between these Release Notes and other App-V documentation, the latest change should be considered authoritative.

segment.source: These release notes supersede the content that is included with this product.
segment.target: These release notes supersede the content that is included with this product.

segment.source: Protect Against Security Vulnerabilities and Viruses
segment.target: Protect Against Security Vulnerabilities and Viruses

segment.source: To help protect against security vulnerabilities and viruses, it is important to install the latest available security updates for any new software being installed.
segment.target: To help protect against security vulnerabilities and viruses, it is important to install the latest available security updates for any new software being installed.

segment.source: For more information, see the Microsoft Security website (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=3482).
segment.target: For more information, see the Microsoft Security website (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=3482).

segment.source: Known Issues with Application Virtualization 4.6 SP3
segment.target: Known Issues with Application Virtualization 4.6 SP3

segment.source: This section provides the most up-to-date information about issues with Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 4.6 SP3.
segment.target: This section provides the most up-to-date information about issues with Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 4.6 SP3.

segment.source: These issues do not appear in the product documentation and in some cases might contradict existing product documentation.
segment.target: These issues do not appear in the product documentation and in some cases might contradict existing product documentation.

segment.source: When it is possible, these issues will be addressed in later releases.
segment.target: When it is possible, these issues will be addressed in later releases.

segment.source: Unable to open hyperlinks using Internet Explorer 11 on Microsoft Windows 8.1 within the Virtual Environment
segment.target: Unable to open hyperlinks using Internet Explorer 11 on Microsoft Windows 8.1 within the Virtual Environment

segment.source: Attempting to open hyperlinks from within a virtual environment will fail on Windows 8.1 using Internet Explorer 11.
segment.target: Attempting to open hyperlinks from within a virtual environment will fail on Windows 8.1 using Internet Explorer 11.

segment.source: This is because Internet Explorer 11 now ships with the Enhanced Protection Mode (EPM) enabled by default and this causes App-V to be unable to access required registry keys, files and communication port objects.
segment.target: This is because Internet Explorer 11 now ships with the Enhanced Protection Mode (EPM) enabled by default and this causes App-V to be unable to access required registry keys, files and communication port objects.

segment.source: WORKAROUND: Disable EPM in Internet Explorer 11 before opening an App-V package.
segment.target: WORKAROUND: Disable EPM in Internet Explorer 11 before opening an App-V package.

segment.source: This will allow you to open Internet Explorer from within the virtual environment.
segment.target: This will allow you to open Internet Explorer from within the virtual environment.
